Service III:Distributed System Development

Being a cloud-based platform, Github,helps developers to store and manage their codes without losing track & control. Besides the functions like Pull Requests, Issues and Comments, it can also include webhooks from any app that you have in your Github repository. With GitHub Actions, you can trigger CI/CD workflows and pipelines of webhooks from these apps, even from a chat message application you can perform these actions. Since GitHub actions are fully integrated with GitHub, we can set any webhook as an event trigger for an automation or CI/CD pipeline.

Technology stack: Distributed Computing, G-Cloud, Cloud Services, Machine Learning, QA Testing, API Development, DevOps, CI/CD, AWS

    Distributed Computing, G-Cloud, Cloud Services, Machine Learning, QA Testing, API Development, DevOps, CI/CD, AWS

Portfolio

Automated testing of WEBGL application

Competencies: Web testing, 3D testing, component testing.

Using powerful mapping tools, Maptive allows users to transform data into a custom Google map in minutes. It provides a lot of tools based on WebGL technology and extends the base functionality.
To test the WEBGL elements, we used such utilities and technologies: Puppeteer, BrowserStack, DriverIO, AWS GPU instances, Google API, CircleCI API, and AWS API.

Github action to retry the other actions and commands

Competencies: GitHub, Github Actions, CI/CD, System Automation

GitHub actions that use an Internet connection can fail when connection is lost. It is a cause of failed jobs. For this case, the action `wretry.action` can retry the action immediately after fail or with some delay. And if the connection is restored, then the job will continue the regular run.
We needed to do reverse engineering of the system to implement our own wrapper over the GitHub action executor. GitHub executor is not an open-source well documented technology and it required much efforts to implement a program that allows to retry actions and have the same system affects as a regular run.
We used reverse engineering to reach the target behavior and the `wTools` framework to implement the action

Noir testing and automatization

Competencies: Software Development, WebAssembly, Rust, Testing, Github Actions, CI/CD

Noir is a Domain Specific Language for SNARK proving systems. It has been designed to use any ACIR-compatible proving system.
We worked on improving CI/CD and fixing the testing environment on the project. We fixed tests of the crate `wasm` inside the `noir` repository. To complete the task, we analyzed the current tests and found the problems with paths and typings.
After analyzing the current system, we proposed changes to optimize workflows by using caches and simplifying the CI process through workflow integration. These suggestions have been acknowledged and are set to be implemented. Additionally, we successfully resolved an issue, which can be found at
